author: gcolvin
content:
My problem with charging for extending memory (<@194433073394352129> 's  concern too https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3336) is that RAM is addressed in pages, and CPU cache in lines, and writing to an address touches only that line and page, not the intervening ones.  How expensive that is depends on lots of things that we probably should consider more than we have -- see [What Every Programmer Should Know About Memory](https://people.freebsd.org/~lstewart/articles/cpumemory.pdf)

(A cost model that charges for extension encourages programs to use  to use MSIZE to mark the next free address, but they can do that no matter the cost model.)
